dmca.title: Logo DMCA (Copyright) Complaint to Twitter
dmca.body:
[redacted], Jul-13 11:16 am (PDT):

Thank You for your email.

I confirm that I have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and

I confirm that the information in the notification is accurate, and, under penalty of perjury, that you are authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.

For your reference, I have also underlined below the statements I made in the original complaint from July 7th which were meant to be the statements you require for the purposes of the DMCA.

Many thank.

Regards, [redacted]

[redacted] | Senior Counsel, RBC Law Group | Royal Bank of Canada | T. [redacted]

 

________________________________


----------------------------------------------
[redacted], Jul-12 09:18 am (PDT):

Hello,

We received your copyright complaint. However, additional information is required to make it an effective notification under the DMCA.
 
We require the following statements pursuant to the DMCA:

5. A statement by you that you have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and

6. A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and, under penalty of perjury, that you are authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.
 
We cannot process your request without a non-defective notice pursuant to the DMCA.  In order to assist us in responding to your request, please submit a complete notice here: 

http://support.twitter.com/forms/dmca
 
Please also confirm that the material which you have identified continues to be infringing or the subject of infringing activity and ensure that the reported material is not protected by fair use.

If your report does not involve an image protected by copyright or links to unauthorized publication of copyrighted materials, chances are, it's not a copyright issue. Here are examples of copyright violations:

- A Twitter account publishing links to free downloads of copyrighted materials.
- A Twitter account using a copyright protected logo or image 

Please be aware that under 17 U.S.C. 512(f), you may be liable for any damages, including costs and attorneysâ€™ fees, incurred by us or our users if you knowingly materially misrepresent that material or activity is infringing.


Thank you,
Twitter Trust and Safety
----------------------------------------------
[redacted], Jul-08 08:11 am (PDT):

Thank You for your email. 
 
For ultimate clarity, although our complaint raises a number of other IP violations by the account user, there is very clearly a copyright violation described in our complaint which warrants that actions we have asked Twitter to take.
Please let me know if you would like to discuss this further.
 
Kind Regards, [redacted]
 

[redacted]| Senior Counsel, RBC Law Group | Royal Bank of Canada | T. [redacted] 

 

________________________________


----------------------------------------------
[redacted], Jul-07 04:02 pm (PDT):

Hello,

If your report does not involve an image protected by copyright or links to unauthorized publication of copyrighted materials, chances are, it's not a copyright issue. Here are examples of copyright violations:


- A Twitter account publishing links to free downloads of copyrighted materials.
- A Twitter account using a copyright protected logo or image (please ensure that the image is not protected by fair use before submitting a take down notice).


Many people confuse copyright with trademark. Our Trademark Policy can be found here:

http://support.twitter.com/articles/18367

An overview of all the Terms of Service or Rules complaints can be found here:

http://support.twitter.com/articles/15789


If you would like us to review specific Tweets, please be sure to include direct links to the Tweets. This help page explains how to find a Tweet's direct status link:

http://support.twitter.com/articles/80586

Terms of Service requests, including trademark, can be filed here:

http://support.twitter.com/forms


Thank you,

[redacted]
Twitter Trust and Safety
----------------------------------------------
[redacted] Jul-07 07:28 am (PDT):

I confirm that the information in my notification is accurate, and,
under penalty of perjury, I am authorized to act on behalf of the
copyright owner. This statement serves as my electronic signature.

[redacted] | Senior Counsel, RBC Law Group | Royal Bank of
Canada | T.[redacted]
 

________________________________


----------------------------------------------
[redacted], Jul-07 07:25 am (PDT):

Twitter, Inc. 
Attn: Copyright Agent 
[redacted]
San Francisco, CA 94107
Email: copyright@twitter.com
 
Subject:        Copyright and IP Violation - Violation of Terms of Use - http://twitter.com/RBCsucks 
 
Dear Sirs ,
 
I am writing to you on behalf of Royal Bank of Canada (Royal Bank), Canada's largest financial institution and [REDACTED], its President and Chief  Executive  Officer.  
 
We were recently made aware that the user of the Twitter page located at http://twitter.com/RBCsucks has uploaded and uses a profile picture that contains a picture of [REDACTED] (image URL: [REDACTED]).  Neither Royal Bank or [REDACTED] created this page or authorized anyone to create this page on their behalf. Such use of [REDACTED]'s identity and image is prohibited by law and is also contrary to your rules.
 
Moreover, said profile picture posted also includes an RBC Lion & Globe design, which is Royal Bank of Canada's key corporate symbol . Royal Bank is the registered owner of the copyright in the RBC Lion & Globe (registered in April 2007 under registration number VA0001418394) and the owner of at least one registered trademark in the said design (registered in September 2004 under registration number 2885583).  Furthermore, the Twitter account uses the RBC trademark which Royal Bank is the owner of several registered trademarks (such as those registered in June 2001 under registration number 2463205 and October 2005 under registration number 3009050).
 
Royal Bank and/or [REDACTED],  have not authorized this use of [REDACTED]'s photo, his image or the copyrighted or trademark protected work on this Twitter page. The online posting, reproduction and display of this work on your website constitutes clear copyright infringement both in the United States of America and in Canada and Twitter is obligated under section Â§512(c)(3) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act to remove the infringing material immediately following the receipt of this letter. The above information regarding these violations is accurate and I declare, under penalty of perjury, having the authority to act in this matter.
 
In light of the foregoing, I trust that Twitter will take the appropriate steps to respect its obligations under the applicable copyright and trademark legislation and to uphold its rules by (i) immediately remove infringing materials and suspend the account in question, (ii) transferring the user name and password to such account to Royal Bank of Canada and (iii) identifying the user that created such page by providing any information available that is in the possession of Twitter.  
 
We would appreciate if you could promptly confirm the removal of the infringing material and the said deactivation and transfer of the account.  
 
Any correspondence regarding this file should be addressed to myself. 
 
Yours truly,

 
[redacted]
Senior Counsel,  Intellectual property
Royal Bank of Canada 
T. [redacted]
_______________________________________________________________________

please advise the sender (by return email or otherwise)
immediately. You have consented to receive the attached
electronically at the above-noted email address; please retain a
copy of this confirmation for future reference.
